body_html:
I tried all the proposed solutions about "pip":

pip install --upgrade pip

And

PYTHONUSERBASE=/usr/local/python pip install --upgrade --user /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-0.7.1-py2-none-any.whl

But I still have the same issue. The module "protobuf" is well installed and recognized by Python, but the module "google.protobuf" is still not known.

I have the same behavior with the 3 different machines I'm testing on.
body_text:

pip install --upgrade pip

And
PYTHONUSERBASE=/usr/local/python pip install --upgrade --user /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-0.7.1-py2-none-any.whl

I have the same behavior with the 3 different machines I'm testing on.
body:
I tried all the proposed solutions about "pip":

```
pip install --upgrade pip
```

And 

```
PYTHONUSERBASE=/usr/local/python pip install --upgrade --user /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-0.7.1-py2-none-any.whl
```

But I still have the same issue. The module "protobuf" is well installed and recognized by Python, but the module "google.protobuf" is still not known.

I have the same behavior with the 3 different machines I'm testing on.
